text: <a href="../Song-of-Solomon-8-1/" title="Song of Solomon 8:1 KJV verse detail"><span id="3" class="versehover">1 O that thou *wert* as my brother, that sucked the breasts of my mother! *when* I should find thee without, I would kiss thee; yea, I should not be despised.

<a href="../Song-of-Solomon-8-2/" title="Song of Solomon 8:2 KJV verse detail"><span id="4" class="versehover">2 I would lead thee, *and* bring thee into my mother's house, *who* would instruct me: I would cause thee to drink of spiced wine of the juice of my pomegranate.
<a href="../Song-of-Solomon-8-3/" title="Song of Solomon 8:3 KJV verse detail"><span id="5" class="versehover">3 His left hand *should be* under my head, and his right hand should embrace me.

<a href="../Song-of-Solomon-8-4/" title="Song of Solomon 8:4 KJV verse detail"><span id="6" class="versehover">4 I charge you, O daughters of Jerusalem, that ye stir not up, nor awake *my* love, until he please.

<a href="../Song-of-Solomon-8-5/" title="Song of Solomon 8:5 KJV verse detail"><span id="7" class="versehover">5 Who *is* this that cometh up from the wilderness, leaning upon her beloved? I raised thee up under the apple tree: there thy mother brought thee forth: there she brought thee forth *that* bare thee.

<a href="../Song-of-Solomon-8-6/" title="Song of Solomon 8:6 KJV verse detail"><span id="8" class="versehover">6 Set me as a seal upon thine heart, as a seal upon thine arm: for love *is* strong as death; jealousy *is* cruel as the grave: the coals thereof *are* coals of fire, *which hath a* most vehement flame.

<a href="../Song-of-Solomon-8-7/" title="Song of Solomon 8:7 KJV verse detail"><span id="9" class="versehover">7 Many waters cannot quench love, neither can the floods drown it: if *a* man would give all the substance of his house for love, it would utterly be contemned.

<a href="../Song-of-Solomon-8-8/" title="Song of Solomon 8:8 KJV verse detail"><span id="10" class="versehover">8 We have a little sister, and she hath no breasts: what shall we do for our sister in the day when she shall be spoken for?

<a href="../Song-of-Solomon-8-9/" title="Song of Solomon 8:9 KJV verse detail"><span id="11" class="versehover">9 If she *be* a wall, we will build upon her a palace of silver: and if she *be* a door, we will inclose her with boards of cedar.

<a href="../Song-of-Solomon-8-10/" title="Song of Solomon 8:10 KJV verse detail"><span id="12" class="versehover">10 I *am* a wall, and my breasts like towers: then was I in his eyes as one that found favour.

<a href="../Song-of-Solomon-8-11/" title="Song of Solomon 8:11 KJV verse detail"><span id="13" class="versehover">11 Solomon had a vineyard at Baalhamon; he let out the vineyard unto keepers; every one for the fruit thereof was to bring a thousand *pieces* of silver.

<a href="../Song-of-Solomon-8-12/" title="Song of Solomon 8:12 KJV verse detail"><span id="14" class="versehover">12 My vineyard, which *is* mine, *is* before me: thou, O Solomon, *must have* a thousand, and those that keep the fruit thereof two hundred.

<a href="../Song-of-Solomon-8-13/" title="Song of Solomon 8:13 KJV verse detail"><span id="15" class="versehover">13 Thou that dwellest in the gardens, the companions hearken to thy voice: cause me to hear *it*.

<a href="../Song-of-Solomon-8-14/" title="Song of Solomon 8:14 KJV verse detail"><span id="16" class="versehover">14 Make haste, my beloved, and be thou like to a roe or to a young hart upon the mountains of spices.
